events.name: Crazy Ideas for 2015 + Cardboard Meetup

group.name: Google Developers Group, Baroda : GDG Baroda

events.description:
So, thank you for being with us all throughout this year, where we did a little from our side. Its time we step up and do something wonderfully better and bring some change. We invite you to our last meetup of the year.

We've got Google Cardboards so we'll be showcasing them and giving a hands-on demo plus we'll be discussing about its SDK.

We'd like to hear your ideas. Also, if you want to help us organizing the events, please let us know. You're welcome even if you just wanna hear what's coming! If you can't attend but would like to propose some events or can help us just drop me a Meetup message or mail ([masked]). We're also looking for companies that would like to sponsor us by offering space/drinks for the events. We're interested in hearing what cool projects your company is working on, too.

RSVP : http://goo.gl/forms/WfC4OHvUp2

events.name: Exploring the World of MVP Design Pattern for Android

group.name: Google Developers Group, Baroda : GDG Baroda

events.description:
Welcome to Google Developers Group Baroda.

We are organizing a meetup for understanding MVP architectural pattern for developing android apps and exploring the benefits of refactoring your old code to the MVP design pattern through an example followed by a discussion.

This would be a part of series of meetups to follow.

MVP (Model View Presenter) pattern is a derivative from the well known MVC (Model View Controller), which for a while now is gaining importance in the development of Android applications. There are more and more people talking about it, but yet very few reliable and structured information. The MVP pattern allows separate the presentation layer from the logic, so that everything about how the interface works is separated from how we represent it on screen. Ideally the MVP pattern would achieve that same logic might have completely different and interchangeable views.

NOTE: This meetup would require attendees to have a basic working knowledge of how to build a simple Android Application and should be familiar with Activities, Views and Java interfaces.

To be eligible for the invite email please fill the form below:

https://goo.gl/9G3eaJ (https://goo.gl/9G3eaJ)

Do not RSVP if you have not received the invitation email from our side. If you do so, your entry would still be considered invalid.

events.name: Essence of Agile WTM January Meetup

group.name: Google Developers Group, Baroda : GDG Baroda

events.description:
And with amazing 2018 start, We are coming with fresh meetup about one of SDLC(Software Development Life Cycle) that is 'Agile'! Let's enjoy our conversations with Kratika, about how AGILE can help us improve our development process!

Agile is a time boxed, iterative approach to software delivery that builds software incrementally from the start of the project, instead of trying to deliver it all at once near the end. So we will be discussing about the Agile methodology and how things has changed in Agile World.

Speaker: Kratika Shah

She is a Java Developer. She has total 5 years of Industrial Experience In Java. She is currently working for Mastercard Mobile Transaction Solutions, Vadodara. She loves learning new things in technology. She believes that code needs to be simple, Keep it simple.

REGISTRATION FORM LINK: https://goo.gl/forms/XdO1yAU5VeMftSMB3

events.name: Unit Testing - WTM Baroda - March Meetup

group.name: Google Developers Group, Baroda : GDG Baroda

events.description:
• What we'll do
We take the opportunity announce February Meetup with an awesome hands-on session on Unit Testing, organized by Women Techmakers Baroda!

To encourage women participation as a part of WTM initiative, women entries would be given priority. Kindly share the same with your female friends & colleagues!

Unit testing finds problems early in the development cycle. This includes both bugs in the programmer's implementation and flaws or missing parts of the specification for the unit. Software unit tests help the developer to verify that the logic of a piece of the program is correct. Running tests automatically helps to identify software regressions introduced by changes in the source code. Having a high test coverage of your code allows you to continue developing features without having to perform lots of manual tests.

The session will be delivered by Praful Prajapati, a Java developer with total 6 years of Industrial Experience In Java. He is currently working for MasterCard Mobile Transaction Solutions, Vadodara. He likes learn and share new things in technology. He believes that code should be as simple as possible.

Attendees will be learning, writing & performing Unit Tests using Java programming language & JUnit Framework. We expect attendees to have at least basic knowledge about Java. We also recommend you to go through
1. Java Documentation: http://docs.oracle.com/javase
2. JUnit Framework: http://junit.org/junit5/

MEETUP REGISTRATION LINK:
https://goo.gl/forms/044tCixG0jdM0uQV2

events.name: IWD '18 Baroda

group.name: Google Developers Group, Baroda : GDG Baroda

events.description:
International Women's Day (http://www.internationalwomensday.com/)

To register please fill this form:
https://goo.gl/forms/Kw0daKu1ATPrynX02

(IWD) is marked on March 8th every year. In different regions, the focus of celebrations ranges from general respect and appreciation toward women to a celebration of women's economic, political, and social achievements. The day also marks a call to action for accelerating gender parity. International Women's Day (IWD) has occurred for well over a century, with the first March 8 IWD gathering supported by over a million people in World.

And here we are celebrating International Women's Day with our amazing event filled with expert sessions and fun activities in Baroda.

Please note that filling up the form does not guarantee your confirmation or invitation to the event. We'll be rolling out confirmation invitations to the selected ones pretty soon!

FAQ

Why does Google celebrate IWD?

From Ada Lovelace to Grace Hopper to thousands of Googlers, we're proud of the contributions women in technology have made across our industry and across our company. And we're excited by the contributions women continue to make today. Google supports and celebrates women in technology through numerous initiatives including Small Business Supplier Diversity and Accelerate with Google programs, the Google Cultural Institute, our Women@ employee resource group and more. International Women's Day is an important moment to recognize how women have influenced the tech industry and beyond.

for more information click here (https://www.womentechmakers.com/iwd17).

Ready for the big announcements of this year from Google IO? Google will show their latest product announcements and improvements in the area of Machine learning, cloud computing, hardware products and last but definitely not least and the thing we all eagerly waited for: Android!

But what if you didn't have the chance to get a Google I/O ticket or you don't want to pay $1500 USD to go? Well, you're in luck :)

Sneh Pandya & Dhruv Apte

Study Jams are community-run study groups for developers. This is a great opportunity to bring community together to learn something in person. These trainings will give you specific skills that you can use for personal development or career advancement!

This year, we will run a series of hands-on with Quicklabs codelabs that walks you through live production environment of Google Cloud Platform, to understand and learn, how Google Cloud Platform works :)

group.name: Google Developers Group, Baroda : GDG Baroda

events.description:
[NOTE] This is an invite-only event and the registration form provided below needs to be filled up, all selected participants will receive confirmation mail 24 hours prior to the event. You must carry the confirmation email to the venue.

Picked from valuable suggestions of the community itself, we are glad to bring a meetup around design!

Speaker:
Aditya Patel

Aditya has been exploring design space since more than 6 years in a row now and have deep knowledge on how things work. He has knowledge about UI, UX, interaction design, UX research process and much more.

This meetup focuses on understanding design in and out. It would be a deeper level understanding of how design impacts our lives. Moreover, the speaker will be talking about how UI & UX impacts decision making while building products around us. This will not only help designers think and visualize better, but also help developers, entrepreneurs, users understand how designers convey meaningful interactions, experiences & help develop better products.

events.name: Google I/O Extended 2019 Baroda

group.name: Google Developers Group, Baroda : GDG Baroda

events.description:
REGISTRATION LINK: https://forms.gle/jVcKsVL2uNuV53FJ7

[NOTE] This is an invite-only event and the registration form provided below needs to be filled up, all selected participants will receive confirmation mail sent by us 24 hours prior to the event. Auto-generated emails from Meetup regarding RSVP, or "You're attending" will not be considered valid confirmation. You must carry the confirmation email sent by us to the venue.

Ready for the big announcements of this year from Google I/O? Google will show their latest product announcements and improvements in the area of Machine learning, cloud computing, hardware products and last but definitely not least and the thing we all eagerly waited for: Android!

But what if you didn't have the chance to get a Google I/O ticket or you don't want to pay $1500 USD to go? Well, you're in luck :)

GDG Baroda celebrates the first day of Google I/O! Enjoy live streams of the talks, participate in games, network with fellow developers and have some fun. We'll enjoy the live stream straight from Google I/O, along with snacks and a lot of fun!

REGISTRATION LINK: https://forms.gle/jVcKsVL2uNuV53FJ7

Would you like to spread the word? Use this hashtag: #io19extended #GDGBaroda

Women Techmakers is a global program encouraging & empowering women, powered by Google.

Speakers:
1) How to Get started building free website using WordPress: Tanvi Shah (Student and blogger)
2) Jump start Android: Kushal Dave (Android Developer)
3) How Sony Hacked : Namrata Brahmkshatriya (Security Analyst)
4) SMART developers and DUMB mistakes: Ravi Rajput (Penetration Tester)

Tanvi Shah is a 3rd year student keen to grab all the opportunities that comes her way. A passionate lifestyle blogger, web developer and Wordpress development enthusiast!

Kushal Dave is developing android apps since late 2015, he done a nanodegree on Android from Udacity and is a google certified android developer, he is currently working as sr Android developer at Wolfsoft pvt ltd.

Namrata Brahmkshatriya is Lead of WTM Baroda and Null Ahmedabad. She has been into physical security, lock picking, psychology and cyber law. She has been training cops of 6 Indian states.

Ravi Rajput is professional penetration tester having experience of more than 7 years. He has been into training cops and taking core conceptual security training in several international communities.

So be prepared for a Jump Start on the above topics and networking!

But, can only women apply?
No! We strive to have a broad representation of attendees in tech including developers, designers, technology entrepreneurs, and many others across all phases of their careers, backgrounds, genders, and walks of life. We welcome all to apply!

events.name: Post I/O networking meetup

group.name: Google Developers Group, Baroda : GDG Baroda

events.description:
Registrations are open: https://forms.gle/bEXZu4dEkYdpVo9cA

We had Sneh, our Co-organizer visit Google I/O in person and he is coming back to share how the experience was.

We will also have various speakers giving lightning talks on what was introduced during Google I/O 2019.

Along with that, this is going to be our mid-year networking event where you will have enough time to meet the organizers, members and attendees to build friendships and your network. Overall, let's have a good fun time.

Agenda for the meetup:

1. Introductions from attendees
2. Sneh - Experiences from attending I/O 2019
3. Chintan - Speech recognition improvements in Google I/O 2019
4. Kushal - What’s new with Jetpack
5. Dhruv - Machin Learning announcements by Jeff Dean at Keynote
6. Hardik - Deliver value for your customers with DevOps
7. Networking.

All the speaker sessions will be 10-15 minutes long.

Registrations are open: https://forms.gle/bEXZu4dEkYdpVo9cA

Confirmed email invites will be sent by Friday, May 24th if you're selected.

group.name: Google Developers Group, Baroda : GDG Baroda

events.description:

Join us on Saturday, June 1st 2019 for the first ever all-day International Flutter™ Hackathon organised by over 2 dozen communities worldwide.

Prior knowledge of Kotlin would be great. Laptop is required. If you have Android Studio IDE, it should work. If you have Android Studio IDE, it should work. events.name: GDG DevFest Baroda 2019 & Kotlin/Everywhere Baroda 2019

group.name: Google Developers Group, Baroda : GDG Baroda

events.description:
TICKETS TO THE EVENT ARE SOLD OUT!!

GDG DevFest Baroda 2019 brings together people who shape the future of Android, Web and Cloud technologies for a day of sessions, workshops and networking.

Described by many as 'The best DevFest in India', our team creates DevFest to be the best place for inspiration and experience sharing.

*** GDG DevFest Baroda 2019 official website: https://devfest.gdgbaroda.com ***

GDG Baroda is also bringing Kotlin/Everywhere global event series with DevFest where experts will be participating to show us what we can do with Kotlin. This event will be part of the themes that will be exhibited within the DevFest Baroda 2019 and that will have renowned speakers.

Just like every year, Baroda invites Googlers, dignitaries, expert speakers, VIPs and organizers from other communities, yet most importantly, diverse & enthusiastic audience.

Witness exceptional speakers invited from across the world, audience from across India & executives from local startups & global enterprises. We thrive to provide the best platform in form of opportunities for everyone! Expect jam packed action content, fun activities, delicious chit chat over food, networking, future growth & much more.

See you at the DevFest!

#GDGBaroda #WTMBaroda #DevFestBaroda #DevFest19 #IndiaDevFest19

events.name: Python for security professionals December 2019 Meetup: WTM Baroda

group.name: Google Developers Group, Baroda : GDG Baroda

events.description:
[NOTE] This is an invite-only event and the registration form provided below needs to be filled up, all selected participants will receive confirmation mail 24 hours prior to the event. You must carry the confirmation email to the venue.

We are proud to announce December meetup discussing about why Python is important in security. Learning, organized by Women Techmakers Baroda & Google Developers Group Baroda.

Speaker: Aashee Shrivastava

Aashee Shrivastava is pursuing Computer Science Engineering from Parul University. She has worked on many mini projects like developing an application that can scan viruses using java, created a Google extension for the same. Passionate about learning how vulnerable our system are and the way in which we can secure them.

We will be creating few tools and will also find and remove meta data, and will collect details about computer system on network and services running on its open ports .
Contents:
1.Intro to python:- functions of python that play role in penetration testing
Basic concepts of python to advance script with focus on networking and security
2. Why is python important for security?
3. Banner grabbing:- developing a banner grabber with python
4. Nmap:- using nmap in python, nmap methods, creating nmap port scanner
5. Brute force password cracker .
6. Using pygeoIP to correlate ip to physical location
7. Finding meta data in image:- extracting meta data from image with python imaging library
8. Editing n removing meta data in image using python n pyexiv2 library.

Laptop and internet is required as this is a workshop session.

REGISTRATION LINK: https://forms.gle/do7eiJxMYZjQJaxi6

If you have not received the invitation email from our side, your entry would still be considered invalid.

events.name: AppFest by GDG Baroda: 1st Edition

group.name: Google Developers Group, Baroda : GDG Baroda

events.description:
[NOTE] We are no longer accepting app submissions. Interested people can attend this event as AUDIENCE. This is an invite-only event and the registration form provided below needs to be filled up, all selected participants will receive confirmation mail 24 hours prior to the event. You must carry the confirmation email to the venue.

Please fill up the form to become an attendee: https://forms.gle/W65bpFiaXMVo3tDf7

During our great successful DevFest, we saw a lot of people wanted to showcase their app on the big stage and hey, we hear you!

We are bringing our next big event: AppFest.

You’ll have a chance to attend app showcase and vote your favourite apps! The teams will present their ideas and win exciting prizes!

Below are the categories apps will be presented for:

- Social: Can an app change people's lives?
- Education: Can an app help solve concerns around today’s education system or make it more affordable for the masses ?
- Sports: Can an app help solving challenges around sports industry and its athlete concerns such as health and fitness, training etc?
- Health and Welfare: Can an app help solving concerns around health and welfare of an individual at scale?
- Finance and Payment: Can an app become the next Google Pay? If yes, what would payment or finance management look like?
- Entertainment: Can an app help small scale artists such as theatre artists connect with larger audience, make entertainment industry more accessible etc?

Please fill up the form to become an attendee: https://forms.gle/W65bpFiaXMVo3tDf7

Save the date: December 29, 2019.

Our year-end meetup won’t be limited to just a networking event anymore 😉

See you there!
